column4: Teledyne to boost imaging sensor portfolio with $8 billion deal for FLIR Systems
column5: (Reuters) -Industrial conglomerate Teledyne Technologies Inc said on Monday it will acquire thermal imaging camera supplier FLIR Systems Inc in a $8 billion cash-and-stock deal to beef up its portfolio of imaging sensor technology.
column6: FLIR shareholders will receive $28 in cash and 0.0718 shares of Teledyne common stock for each share held, the companies said.
column7: That implies a purchase price of $56.14 based on Teledyne’s last close, and represents a premium of 28.1% for FLIR shareholders to the stock’s Thursday close.
column8: Teledyne and FLIR sell cameras and sensor systems.
column9: “Our technologies and products are uniquely complementary with minimal overlap, having imaging sensors based on different semiconductor technologies for different wavelengths,” Teledyne Executive Chairman Robert Mehrabian said.
column10: The deal is expected to close in the middle of 2021 and add to Teledyne earnings in the first full calendar year after the acquisition.
column11: FLIR shares jumped 25.4% to $54.39 in premarket trading on Monday.
column12: Evercore acted as financial adviser to Teledyne and Goldman Sachs & Co LLC advised FLIR.

column4: Teledyne Technologies to buy FLIR Systems in $8 bln deal
column5: Jan 4 (Reuters) - Industrial conglomerate Teledyne Technologies Inc said on Monday it will acquire thermal imaging camera supplier FLIR Systems Inc in a $8 billion cash-and-stock deal. (Reporting by Munsif Vengattil; Editing by Shinjini Ganguli)
